<div id="data_types" class="registered_link"></div>

This table lists all the Oracle data types and provides the following information for each. If:
- The data type does not apply to Postgres databases.
- EDB Postgres Advanced Server has implemented an compatible replacement for the Oracle data types that don't have a suitable equivalent in PostgreSQL. The description includes a link to the implementation details in the EDB Postgres Advanced Server documentation.
- EDB Postgres Advanced Server provides synonyms for PostgreSQL types that can be used directly in place of the equivalent Oracle type.  The description includes a link to the implementation details in the PostgreSQL docs. 


|                             Oracle data type                              |                                                                                               Description                                                                                               |
| ------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| ANYDATA                                                                   |  Not applicable to Postgres.                                                                                                                                                                                                       |
| ANYDATASET                                                                |  Not applicable to Postgres.                                                                                                                                                                                                           |
| ANYTYPE                                                                   |  Not applicable to Postgres.                                                                                                                                                                                                           |
| BFILE                                                                     |                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
| BINARY_DOUBLE                                                             |                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
| BINARY_FLOAT                                                              |                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
| [BLOB](03_binary_data#blob)   | EDB Postgres Advanced Server implements as BYTEA. See [Binary data](/03_binary_data).  
| BLOB, LONG RAW, RAW(size)                                                 | EDB Postgres Advanced Server implements as BYTEA. See [Binary data](/03_binary_data).
| BLOB, LONG RAW, RAW(size)                                                 | EDB Postgres Advanced Server implements as BYTEA. See [Binary data](/03_binary_data).                                                                                                                 |
| CHAR [(size [BYTE \  CHAR])]                                              | Maps to PostgreSQL [character types](https://www.postgresql.org/docs/current/datatype-character.html).                                                                                                  |
| CLOB                                                                      | EDB Postgres Advanced Server implements as CLOB. See [CLOB](/02_character_types/#clob).                                                                                                                 |
| DATE                                                                      |                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
| FLOAT [(p)]                                                               |                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
| INTERVAL DAY [(day_precision)] TO SECOND [(fractional_seconds_precision)] |                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
| INTERVAL YEAR [(year_precision)] TO MONTH                                 |                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
| LONG                                                                      |                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
| NCHAR[(size)]                                                             |                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
| NCLOB                                                                     |                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
| NUMBER [ (p [, s]) ]                                                      |                                                                                                                                                                                                        |
| NVARCHAR2(size), VARCHAR2, VARCHAR                                        | EDB Postgres Advanced Server implements as CHARACTER VARYING(n). See [VARCHAR, VARCHAR2, NVARCHAR and NVARCHAR2](/02_character_types#varchar-varchar2-nvarchar-and-nvarchar2).                           |
| ROWID                                                                     |                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
| TIMESTAMP [(fractional_seconds_precision)]                                |                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
| TIMESTAMP [(fractional_seconds_precision)] WITH LOCAL TIME ZONE           |                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
| TIMESTAMP [(fractional_seconds_precision)] WITH TIME ZONE                 |                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
| UROWID [(size)]                                                           |                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
| XMLtype                                             | Maps to PostgreSQL [XML](https://www.postgresql.org/docs/current/datatype-xml.html)type. See [XML type](06_xml_type) for information on the differences between Oracle and Postgres for this data type. |
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                ## Another version of the table
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              | Oracle data type    | EPAS data type                         | Description                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          |   
|---------------------|----------------------------------------|----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| `BINARY_DOUBLE`     | [`DOUBLE PRECISION`](01_numeric_types) | The EPAS `DOUBLE PRECISION` data type is a native PostgreSQL data type that maps to Oracle's `BINARY_DOUBLE` data type. See [Floating Point Types](https://www.postgresql.org/docs/15/datatype-numeric.html#DATATYPE-FLOAT) in the PostgreSQL documentation.             |   
| `BINARY_FLOAT`      | [`FLOAT`](01_numeric_types)            | The EPAS `FLOAT` data type is an alias of PostgreSQL's `DOUBLE PRECISION` data type that maps to Oracle's `BINARY_FLOAT` data type. See [Floating Point Types](https://www.postgresql.org/docs/15/datatype-numeric.html#DATATYPE-FLOAT) in the PostgreSQL documentation. |   
| `ROWID`             | [`ROWID`](01_numeric_types)            | The EPAS `ROWID` data type maps to Oracle's `ROWID` data type. It is a custom data type of EPAS and isn't available in PostgreSQL.                                                                                                                               |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |   |   |   |   |
| `CLOB`              | [`CLOB`](01_numeric_types)            | The EPAS `CLOB` data type maps to Oracle's `CLOB` data type. It is a custom data type of EPAS and isn't available in PostgreSQL. This data type is only available in Oracle-compatibility mode.                                                                                                                              |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |   |   |   |   |


| Oracle data types                  | PostgreSQL data types                                                                                | EPAS Oracle mode <br/> (PostgreSQL alias)                       | EPAS Postgres mode <br/> (PostgreSQL alias) |
| ---------------------------------- | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------|-------------------------------------- |
| `BINARY_DOUBLE`                    |[`DOUBLE PRECISION`](https://www.postgresql.org/docs/15/datatype-numeric.html#DATATYPE-FLOAT)        | [`DOUBLE PRECISION`](01_numeric_types)                      | `DOUBLE PRECISION`                      |
| `BINARY_FLOAT`                     | [`DOUBLE PRECISION`](https://www.postgresql.org/docs/15/datatype-numeric.html#DATATYPE-FLOAT)        | [`FLOAT`](01_numeric_types)<br/>(`DOUBLE PRECISION`)               | `FLOAT`<br/> (`DOUBLE PRECISION`)              |
| `NUMBER(p [, s ] )`                | [`NUMERIC`](https://www.postgresql.org/docs/current/datatype-numeric.html#DATATYPE-NUMERIC-DECIMAL)  | [`NUMBER (p[,s])`](01_numeric_types)<br/>(`NUMERIC`)               | `NUMBER (p[,s])`<br/> (`NUMERIC`)              |
| `ROWID`                            | Not available                                                                                        | [`ROWID`](01_numeric_types)                                 | `ROWID`                                 |
| `CHAR[(n)]`                        | [`CHAR`](https://www.postgresql.org/docs/15/datatype-character.html)                                 | [`CHAR`](02_character_types)                                | `CHAR`                                  |
| `CLOB`                                     | Not available                                                                                | [`CLOB`](02_character_types)                                | Not available                         |
| `LONG`                                     | [`TEXT`](https://www.postgresql.org/docs/15/datatype-character.html)                         | [`LONG`](02_character_types)<br/>(`TEXT`)                          | `LONG`<br/> (`TEXT`)                           |
| `LONG VARCHAR`                             | [`TEXT`](https://www.postgresql.org/docs/15/datatype-character.html)                         | [`LONG VARCHAR`](02_character_types)<br/>(`TEXT`)                  | `LONG VARCHAR`<br/> (`TEXT`)                   |
| `NCHAR`                                    | [`CHARACTER`](https://www.postgresql.org/docs/15/datatype-character.html)                    | [`NCHAR`](02_character_types)<br/>(`CHARACTER`)                    | `NCHAR`<br/> (`CHARACTER VARYING`)             |
| `NVARCHAR2(n)`                             | [`CHARACTER VARYING`](https://www.postgresql.org/docs/15/datatype-character.html)            | [`NVARCHAR2`](02_character_types)<br/>(`CHARACTER VARYING`)        | `NVARCHAR2`<br/>(`CHARACTER VARYING`)         |
| `VARCHAR2(n)`                             | [`CHARACTER VARYING`](https://www.postgresql.org/docs/15/datatype-character.html)             | [`VARCHAR2(n)`](02_character_types)<br/>(`CHARACTER VARYING`)      | `VARCHAR2(n)`<br/> (`CHARACTER VARYING`)       |
| `BLOB`                                    | [`BYTEA`](https://www.postgresql.org/docs/15/datatype-binary.html)                            | [`BLOB`](03_binary_data)<br/>(`BYTEA`)                             | `BLOB` <br/>(`BYTEA`)                          |
| `LONG RAW`                                | [`BYTEA`](https://www.postgresql.org/docs/15/datatype-binary.html)                            | [`LONG RAW`](03_binary_data)<br/>(`BYTEA`)                         | `LONG RAW`<br/> (`BYTEA`)                      |
| `RAW`                                     | [`BYTEA`](https://www.postgresql.org/docs/15/datatype-binary.html)                            | [`RAW`](03_binary_data)<br/>(`BYTEA`)                              | `RAW`<br/> (`BYTEA`)                           |
| `DATE`                                    | [`TIMESTAMP WITHOUT TIME ZONE`](https://www.postgresql.org/docs/15/datatype-datetime.html)    | [`DATE`](04_date_time_types)<br/>(`TIMESTAMP WITHOUT TIME ZONE`)   | `DATE`<br/> (`TIMESTAMP WITHOUT TIME ZONE`)    |
| `INTERVAL`                                 | [`INTERVAL`](https://www.postgresql.org/docs/15/datatype-datetime.html#DATATYPE-INTERVAL-INPUT) | [`INTERVA`L](04_date_time_types)                         | `INTERVAL`                              |
| `TIMESTAMP WITH/WITHOUT TIME ZONE` | [`TIMESTAMP WITH/WITHOUT TIME ZONE`](https://www.postgresql.org/docs/15/datatype-datetime.html) | [`TIMESTAMP WITH/WITHOUT TIMEZONE`](04_date_time_types)  | `TIMESTAMP WITH/WITHOUT TIME ZONE`      |
| `XMLTYPE`                                  | [`XML`](https://www.postgresql.org/docs/15/datatype-xml.html)                                   | [`XMLTYPE`](06_xml_type)                                 | `XML`                                   |
